message: I still love IRC, but Convore will certianly come in handy.. esp. when they block IRC at my job. ;-)

@craigrood completely agree. i really see this ( and hope!) that this fosters better/more group messaging.... but doesn't turn into -i don't know how else to say it- group chat.  am i crazy for seeing these as different?
I don't think twit will ever adopt this, as there is no censorship.
irc is so 1993. ;)
Depends..which one is blue?
@ponglenis do you really like the way the Nazi Moderators control what you say?
@thewalter take it easy, later
Cool! This is still active.
@thewalter no! i fucking hate it. but that's exactly why this will not fly
@ponglenis u get a gold star for that
@ponglenis who is this person, and WHAT is he talking about

Convore is more of a forum platform than an IRC, so if you just want to chat about tech or whatever hit up the IRC, but for specific show discussions, ideas, feedback and what not - post them in this group so everyone can see it and participate :)
Can we act a little more mature here? Also I can see what you have done with your username 'ponglenis'
i got banned for this username, go figure
@craigrood Then they can leave, we should be able to have an adult chat if we choose to
Another GOLD star
I'm not trying to convince you to no swear, but i think from Leos perspective he has to.
I am sure he does, he does more cursing on the network than anyone
so true, the moderators make me sick...how politically correct and GOD like they try to get
@craigrood hey look, I love Leo, I am also a paid supporter of the show, but I am also an adult and could care less about the (children)  Just trying to b real
@evilbot image me horses
twit should create a cursing-allowed tech show
i bet Leo wants to
i love him for that. all the respressive crap needs to stop. people should grow a pare/
@thewalter fucking right brother!
nice, my first :)
*pair
everybody curses, it's called spoken language. cursing does not mean you cannot be civil.
Cursing is 'fine', infact if you know me IRL its part of my vocabulary - but a little respect to those who dont want to hear it goes a long way.
everybody takes offense to something. the miracle cure for people to have a sense of pragmatism and humor
@ponglenis I am NOT in this world to make everyone like me...no matter what I do...some ppl wont
they should create a cursing and non-cursing chatroom. which one will have the most users? hmmm...
Just give me the option to express myself the way I want
@craigrood #unfiltered never gets mentioned on the air.
@irock Even older ;-)
theres #unfiltered on IRC - thats exactly what its for
i gotta get back to work, chat ya later
plus the idea is to let twit hosts express themselves freely
@craigrood You're right, way more forum-like. But I'm old school and like IRC is all.
i try not to curse, but i think an occasional shit or dammit, should be ok. iv been kicked for both

@ponglenis That'll never happen so long as TWiT wants to appeal to *everyone*.  I don't think the shows suffer just because there is no swearing, although I do hate getting kicked from chat for saying totally innocuous words.
These are archived forever
Not sure how long these are archived. For short term archiving of show links or #help answers convore might be useful. I don't see it as a substitute for the IRC during live shows.
lets do it then.

I didn't do anything "adult" i made a Google doc listing all the infractions committed by the TWiT staff,  ,when Leo was away. It was pretty funny, and not remotely serious, stuff like Amber had her hair in a pony tail and the mod gave me a lifetime ban.
I would like to see this format with more traffic in order to see how it could replace IRC,
test, i mean
I think that as long as pol are swearing in here twit should avoid it. They run a family friendly site that is paid for by advertisers. Keep that in mind while commenting.
The advertisers are the ones that care about swearing, but i am sure that this could be moderated.
Twit could do some thing really interesting, by including chat logs as a closed captioning option in the videos, especially if they are moderated real time.
bump

If Convore could be integrated into the shows (and IRC) I am on board. I used a Convore for a business working group yesterday. This could be something. As for mod's I say make it TWiT's sandbox and their rules.
Moderator and moderation appreciated: (however,cursing is great for the communication/vocabulary-challenged)

This site will need some sort of moderation but at the start we can make it unmodded and let IRC be modded and see if we can control ourselves, hopefully peer pressure will work. If not, we can try fear, fear of this battle station.
Wow... this interface is terrible.  Neat idea though!!  I'm not sure how it could be used, but new tools are always good.
@richardya Ah, but is your battle station fully functional?
@SlyFerret  this interface is terrible?? i'm curious as to what design/UI you prefer...

@calebcherry I see 5 lines on the screen. That's clearly not enough. They need to get rid of the bit "convore" bar at the top, and the green line as well, they take up space for no good reason and could accommodate some more chat lines, and there is space for more at the bottom. And the "member" window on the let should be able to fold away since it took just takes up space for no really good reason. The chat areas, this, should be resizeable so they can become wider and display more. The 'recent topics' list doesn't have a scroll bar, and at the moment i can't see any topics at all because this box i'm typing into has expanded enough to cover up all recent topics.
Dude, are you using Chrome? Chrome messes everything up usually.
What browser are you using to view Convore?
The Heading area at the top of convore is a bit too large... when you are in a thread it should only have that little black bar, and nothing else (not the gray or the green area)
@hippiebutter It looks the same in them all. Chrome, Firefox, IE8, Opera
@richardya Chrome generally gets html more right than most browsers
@HateBadDesign Thank You
To me, convore seems sorta like a Twitter that is based on a subject rather then a person.
works ok for me using Chrome.

I don't know, Chrome is weird for me, for example the address bar icons don't show up right and some cheaper websites don't format right. My guess, is the security settings are just higher by default and somehow that screws with some stuff
Chrome works fine for me as well...
@JustSuds https://convore.com/convorsation/ https://convore.com/conk-a-convore-mobile-client/
Who remembers the names of the android apps that are out so far?
@JustSuds Convorsation and Conk
@JustSuds No problem
@ericflo Thankyou very much. :-)
sounds like he could be using the safari app in a mobile device: iPhone, Touch, Droid..
